resources.string: Are you sure want to cancel survey?
Please enter email or assignment code
Please enter valid email or assignment code
Something went wrong. Please check your internet connection or try again.
Would you like to be contacted by a Psychologist soon?

We strongly recommend that you contact Response Psychological to arrange an appointment, either by phone or skype, with one of their Psychologists who provide 24/7 counselling support to all volunteers.
No problems. Remember, if your situtation changes - we are here to help. Make contact with Response Psychological to arrange an appointment with a Psychologist.
Would you like to complete the online self assessment?

That's great! The online self-assessment is intended to obtain information from you regarding your deployment experience. Our Clinical Services Team will review your responses and arrange individual follow-up by phone or skype. Your individual responses will be retained in the strictest confidence by Response Psychological Services. When you are ready to being the online self-assessment, click here

No problems, we remind all volunteers every six months that the online self-assessment tool is available. Should you want to use this helpful tool, you can find it under the “Tools” tab in this app. Remember, your individual responses will be retained in the strictest confidence by Response Psychological Services.

The online self-assessment is a helpful tool intended to obtain information from you regarding your deployment experience. The Clinical Services Team at Response Psychological Services will review your responses and can arrange individual follow-up by phone or skype. Your individual responses will be retained in the strictest confidence by Response Psychological Services. If you would like to complete this helpful tool at a later time, you can find it under the “Tools” tab in this app.
Thank you for completing the Mental Wellbeing Check-in

Should you wish to re-complete the Mental Wellbeing check-in sometime in the future, please look for it in the \"Tools\" section of this app. \n \nIf you are ever feeling down or unwell, remember there is always help available and support by the Program.
For a more in-depth wellbeing self assessment, consider completing the Mental Health Online Self-Assessment.\n \n Click Here

Your responses will be reviewed by a member of Respone Psychological's Clinical Services Team. 

But again, if you feel your situation is deteriorating, Please contact Response Psychological directly and without delay.

In addition to the above, there are also many helpful resources to be found at the following websites:
In terms of your mental health how are you going?
In terms of your mental health how are you going?
In terms of your mental health how are you going?

Great, but remember things can change. It is important to maintain a healthy lifestyle and put in place wellbeing strategies that work for you. These strategies may include: building relationships; exercising and eating healthy; maintain a positive mindset; identify and use your strengths; or, contribute to your community. If you find yourself struggling to cope with everyday life, find meaning or feel connected to others, consider talking to someone, a friend, family member or a counsellor / psychologist at Response Psychological.

OK, this might be important. Remember when we are feeling overwhelmed, it can be hard to make sense of things and put our feelings into words. If you continue to feel "out-of-sorts", consider reducing and managing your stress levels, exercise and eat healthy, reduce alcohol and / or drug intake. If you continue to feel low or find yourself struggling to cope with everyday life, find meaning or feel connected to others, consider talking to someone, a friend, family member or a counsellor / psychologist at Response Psychological.

If you have been feeling unwell, sad, or miserable for more than two weeks, or have lost interest or pleasure in usual activities, then you may be depressed. There are many resources with information on what you can do to help yourself.

Some of these include:

However, while it is good to work on some things that you can do for yourself, remember, you don't have to face these challenges alone. It's important to let others known how you feel when things don't go to plan. Don't build up worries, anger or disappointments - talk about them. There are many support options, such as speaking to a counsellor /psychologist at Response Psychological, visiting a health professional or talking to a close friend or family member.
